comment._content: Here is a bit of inconsequential fun thanks to a Trove search. Every photographer who was anybody in Sydney in the late 19th/early 20th century seems to have photographed Petty’s Hotel from this similar viewpoint, maybe to sell to wealthy patrons as souvenirs or postcards. The hotel gained an extra floor c.1880, and here are seven other views from earliest to latest, judging by the height of the (bunyah pine?) trees at the front. Early time-lapse photography! Open in new tabs – acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=412454 www.slv.vic.gov.au/pictoria/gid/slv-pic-aab74193/1/b52381 www.flickr.com/photos/41452678@N05/4002291589/ nla.gov.au/nla.pic-vn4196918 Then this Henry King view above www.slv.vic.gov.au/pictoria/gid/slv-pic-aab70539/1/a14701 www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/3004416518/ acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=413698 I bet there are more photos of Petty’s out there!
